bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Telegram from Alice [s.n.] and Burke [s.n.] to Philip Showalter Hench, October 26, 1940

div1.p: Alice and Burke congratulate Hench and are sorry they cannot attend the Washington and Jefferson College event.

div1.head: Telegram from Alice [s.n.] and Burke [s.n.] to Philip Showalter Hench, October 26, 1940
div1.opener:
WESTERN
UNION
1201
R. B. WHITE
PRESIDENT
NEWCOMB CARLTON
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD
J. C. WILLEVER
FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt is STANDARD TIME at point of destination
GAT14 21 NT=KR BROOKLINE MASS 25
1940 OCT 26 AM 7 54
DR PHILIP S HENCH= CARE WASH AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE WASHINGTON PENN=
div1.p:
CONGRATULATIONS AND MANY THANKS SORRY WE CANNOT BE WITH
YOU. THE BEST OF EVERYTHING FOR YOU DEAR BOY LOVE TO ALL=
div1.closer: AUNT ALICE AND UNCLE BURKE. THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
